smtools.application.registry

Class Registry

  • java.lang.Object
    • smtools.application.registry.Registry

  • public final class Registry
extends java.lang.Object
    The Registry class provides a mechanism for accessing (persistent) global variables.

    The Registry class is actually a singleton instance, and a local reference to it should be obtained as follows:

      Registry localReference = Registry.getInstance();
    The registry itself contains different hives (which are classes implementing the Hive interface), such as for example the Hive implementation. From anywhere within the application, the registry can be accessed using the aforementioned locally constructed reference. Furthermore, all hives in the registry can be serialised for persisent storage to a file (as well as deserialising from a file).

    Each hive in the registry has a unique name, and can individually be saved to and removed from the registry. Continuing the previous train of thought, we can for example obtain a local reference to a hive as follows:

      Hive hive = (Hive) localReference.getHive("hive");

    When consecutively loading multiple registries, they are joined together in memory.

    Note that a valid I18NL10N database must be available!

    Note that this class cannot be subclassed!

    Version:
    04/12/2012
    Author:
    Sven Maerivoet

           Hive hive)
        Adds a hive to the registry.
        Parameters:
        hiveName - the name of the hive to add
        hive - the hive to add

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Clears the registry of all hives.

      • getHive

        public Hive getHive(java.lang.String hiveName)
        Retrieves a hive from the registry.

        If the hive is not found in the registry, null is returned.

        Parameters:
        hiveName - the name of the hive to retrieve
        See Also:
        Hive

      • getInstance

        public static Registry getInstance()
        Returns the singleton instance of the Registry class.
        Returns:
        the singleton instance of the Registry class

      • load

        public void load(java.lang.String filename)
          throws RegistryException
        Loads all hives in the registry from a file using deserialisation.
        Parameters:
        filename - the name of the file to load the registry from
        Throws:
        RegistryException - if an error occurred during the deserialisation process

      • loadHive

        public Hive loadHive(java.lang.String filename)
              throws RegistryException
        Loads a hive from a file using deserialisation.
        Parameters:
        filename - the name of the file to load the hive from
        Returns:
        the hive loaded from the file
        Throws:
        RegistryException - if an error occurred during the deserialisation process
        See Also:
        Hive

      • removeHive

        public void removeHive(java.lang.String hiveName)
                throws RegistryException
        Removes a hive from the registry.
        Parameters:
        hiveName - the name of the hive to remove
        Throws:
        RegistryException - if the hive could not be found in the registry
        See Also:
        Hive

      • save

        public void save(java.lang.String filename)
          throws RegistryException
        Saves all hives in the registry to a file using serialisation.

        Note that care should be taken that all the fields in all the hives are serialisable.

        Parameters:
        filename - the name of the file to save the registry to
        Throws:
        RegistryException - if an error occurred during the serialisation process

      • saveHive

        public void saveHive(Hive hive,
            java.lang.String filename)
              throws RegistryException
        Saves a hive to a file using serialisation.

        Note that care should be taken that all the fields in the specified hive are serialisable.

        Parameters:
        hive - the hive to save
        filename - the name of the file to save the hive to
        Throws:
        RegistryException - if an error occurred during the serialisation process
        See Also:
        Hive
